C

call(Callable<T>) - Static method in class com.chaining.Chain
start a chain of Functions throw passing a Callable that will return the root item
call() - Method in class com.chaining.Chain
call the Object after being updated
call(Callable<T>) - Static method in class com.chaining.Guard
execute the passed Callable safely, which will handle any thrown Exception internally, you will need to call Guard.onErrorReturnItem(Object) or Guard.onErrorReturn(Function) to continue chaining the function calls, or you can call Guard.onError(Consumer) to finish the chain
callWithCallableThenReturnTheCallableResult() - Method in class com.chaining.ChainTest
 
callWithCrashingCallableThenThrowException() - Method in class com.chaining.ChainTest
 
Chain<T> - Class in com.chaining
a class that encapsulates chaining multiple operations to be invoked on an Object through chained sequence of operations, then you can get the Object finally through calling Chain.call()
ChainConfiguration - Class in com.chaining
a class that handles the configurations of the Chain class

ChainTest - Class in com.chaining

collect(Class<R>) - Method in class com.chaining.Chain
collect the stored Iterable item into a Collector Object, if the stored item is not of type Iterable, this method will create a Collector with a List of one item, which is the stored item, you can then invoke Collector.and(Object) to append other items to the current items
Collector<T> - Class in com.chaining
a class that keeps collecting new items into a list then returns the new List on request

Condition<T> - Class in com.chaining
a function that will not execute the Consumer passed to the Condition.then(Consumer) until the Predicate passed to it returned true, else it will change nothing
